Hi Richard.

It is possible to combine NEAT with back-prop, but I don't kno=
w how. I 
don't think that this will bring any benefit at all, since NEAT 
=
automatically discovers the best structure and weights for the given 
probl=
em.
If you care only about the network's best topolgy, you can evolve 
netw=
orks with NEAT and assign them fitness values according to how well 
they p=
erform on back-prop learning... I guess... 

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, R=
ichard Gong <gongrichard@...> wrote:
>

e sharpNEAT code...

it just randomly 
evolve networks, and combine the best genes? Once you evo=
lve a network, 
and you use backprop on it?

AT example in c++? (preferably a 
multiplexer or something simple, not like=
 smart sweepers)
